markdown: {{Cut content}} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [quest](/pillarsOfEternityIiDeadfireQuests/) in {{poe2}}. ## Synopsis I found [Masog](/masog/)'s spirit along a walkway within the [Serpent's Crown](/serpentsCrown/). He had been pushed from the walkway, and was understandably distraught about the experience. I told him I would try to track down who had done this to him. ## Behind the scenes * This quest is incomplete, and while journal entries for it exist, it seems that there is no way to start it. * The global variable n_Upon_New_Shores_Main_State is used for this quest, but doesn't seem to be set or queried anywhere. ## Journal {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" style="word-break:break-all" | quests\04_neketaka_palace_district\04_qst_upon_new_shores + 03_qst_upon_new_shores |- ! width="40px" | {{tooltip|ID|Objectives: 0, Descriptions: 10000, Addenda: 20000, End states: 30000, Alternate descriptions: 40000}} ! colspan="2" | Objectives |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''0''' | colspan="2" | '''Upon New Shores''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10000 | I found Masog's spirit along a walkway within the Serpent's Crown. He had been pushed from the walkway, and was understandably distraught about the experience. I told him I would try to track down who had done this to him. |- | rowspan="4" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''1''' | colspan="2" | '''Find the Servant''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10001 | From the details Masog recalled, it seems like his attacker was a servant somewhere near the Palace. I should start my investigation there |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20000 | A servant mentioned that one of their own, a weaver, has been missing for quite some time. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20001 | Within the weaver's basket, I found a note containing directions to her home in the Gullet. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''2''' | colspan="2" | '''Track the Servant down in the Gullet''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10002 | |- | rowspan="5" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''3''' | colspan="2" | '''Survive the attack''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10003 | |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20002 | I've eliminated the sailors. They're no longer a threat to anyone. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20003 | The servant, Ereti, told a story of Huana slaves, captured by the Vailian Trading Company and recently traded to the captain of the Antelope. She was able to get a message to her tribesmates, but was discovered soon afterward. Ereti gave me a map with the Antelope's route before she perished. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20004 | The servant, Ereti, has perished. On searching her pockets, I found a map marking the route of a ship named the Antelope. |- | rowspan="5" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''4''' | colspan="2" | '''Find the Aedyran Captain's ship''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10004 | |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20005 |I've found the Antelope in open water. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20006 | Pulling alongside the Antelope, I was met by her captain, Teryc Lofell. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20007 | My conversation with the captain was interrupted by horrible screams from the lower decks. |- | rowspan="6" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''5''' | colspan="2" | '''Defeat the Effigy of Skaen''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10005 | |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20008 | |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20009 | I've subdued the Effigy. Skaen had a few comments for me before reclaiming his essence and leaving. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20010 | Captain Lofell and the rest of the Antelope crew has been killed. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20011 | With the Effigy defeated, the slaves are to be thrown overboard on Captain Lofell's command. |- ! colspan="3" | End states |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30000 | I decided to kill everyone on the Antelope. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30001 | I sided with Captain Teryc Lofell, defeating the Effigy and having the slaves thrown overboard to prevent the worship of Skaen from spreading throughout the islands. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30002 | Even though I defeated their Effigy, I decided to side with the slaves against Captain Lofell. |}

He had been pushed from the walkway, and was understandably distraught about the experience. I told him I would try to track down who had done this to him. ==Behind the scenes== * This quest is incomplete, and while journal entries for it exist, it seems that there is no way to start it. * The global variable n_Upon_New_Shores_Main_State is used for this quest, but doesn't seem to be set or queried anywhere. ==Journal== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" style="word-break:break-all" | quests\04_neketaka_palace_district\04_qst_upon_new_shores + 03_qst_upon_new_shores |- ! width="40px" | {{tooltip|ID|Objectives: 0, Descriptions: 10000, Addenda: 20000, End states: 30000, Alternate descriptions: 40000}} ! colspan="2" | Objectives |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''0''' | colspan="2" | '''Upon New Shores''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10000 | I found Masog's spirit along a walkway within the Serpent's Crown. I told him I would try to track down who had done this to him. |- | rowspan="4" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''1''' | colspan="2" | '''Find the Servant''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10001 | From the details Masog recalled, it seems like his attacker was a servant somewhere near the Palace. They're no longer a threat to anyone. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20003 | The servant, Ereti, told a story of Huana slaves, captured by the Vailian Trading Company and recently traded to the captain of the Antelope. She was able to get a message to her tribesmates, but was discovered soon afterward. Ereti gave me a map with the Antelope's route before she perished. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20004 | The servant, Ereti, has perished. On searching her pockets, I found a map marking the route of a ship named the Antelope. |- | rowspan="5" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''4''' | colspan="2" | '''Find the Aedyran Captain's ship''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10004 | |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20005 |I've found the Antelope in open water. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20006 | Pulling alongside the Antelope, I was met by her captain, Teryc Lofell. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20007 | My conversation with the captain was interrupted by horrible screams from the lower decks. |- | rowspan="6" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''5''' | colspan="2" | '''Defeat the Effigy of Skaen''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10005 | |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20008 | |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20009 | I've subdued the Effigy. Skaen had a few comments for me before reclaiming his essence and leaving. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20010 | Captain Lofell and the rest of the Antelope crew has been killed. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20011 | With the Effigy defeated, the slaves are to be thrown overboard on Captain Lofell's command. |- ! colspan="3" | End states |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30000 | I decided to kill everyone on the Antelope. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30001 | I sided with Captain Teryc Lofell, defeating the Effigy and having the slaves thrown overboard to prevent the worship of Skaen from spreading throughout the islands. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30002 | Even though I defeated their Effigy, I decided to side with the slaves against Captain Lofell. |}
title: Upon New Shores
